DataElement.preferredName: Breast Distant Cancer Progression Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body for distant breast cancer progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body._A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.:A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition with current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side (of the body): One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Beneath the skin.: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Beneath the skin.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Beneath the skin.: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Beneath the skin.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

Concepts.definition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the area below the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the area below the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the same side of the body.: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the same side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
